entry.title: The Trial of Uther Pendragon
entry.summary:
Author: HerMajestyofLichtenstein

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,268Chapters: 38/?Kudos: 1,382

Summary: When Morgana invokes a long forgotten spell, the ancient and powerful Court of Magic is summoned to pass judgment on Uther Pendragon and his bloodline for their crimes against the magical world. But for the verdict to be carried out, every seat on the Council must be filled, and the chair of the Dragonlords has long stood empty. Now Merlin faces an impossible choice: side with his people and end Uther’s reign of terror, or save Arthur.

entry.title: The Kitchen Boy's Secret
entry.summary:
Author: The_green_fairy

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,485Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 19

Summary: Merlin has spent six months invisible in Camelot's kitchens, taking on extra work to avoid the other servants who sense something different about him. He hides his magic carefully in a world where it's scorned, hoping kindness will win him acceptance. Then Arthur's servant mistakes him for one of the king's harem boys. What begins as a humiliating mix-up becomes something neither of them expected. Arthur can't forget his pretty kitchen boy—the virgin who talked with him until dawn.

entry.summary:
Author: Eez_fan_works

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 57,166Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 1,166

entry.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Time
entry.summary:
Author: HarmonyOfTheSpheres

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,732Chapters: 11/21Kudos: 376

Summary: Merlin has returned to Hogwarts for his second year as the History of Magic professor, and this time he is determined to find a way to destroy the horcrux within Harry before it's too late. It's not exactly a simple task, however, especially with an escaped convict on the loose and dementors lurking around Hogwarts' grounds. So when Merlin finally gets a chance to change Harry's fate, he takes it.A bit of time travel is surely worth the risk if it will save Harry's life—isn't it?

entry.title: I Want to Make You My Problem
entry.summary:
Author: applezest

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,412Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 2

Summary: In which Merlin is a theatre usher and Arthur is a new security guard. Merlin has been an usher at Camelot Theatre in the West End ever since he moved to London to live with his godfather Gaius. Now the theatre is under the new management of Uther Pendragon, who appears to have brought his entire family on its payroll. The new head of security operations and security guard Arthur is annoying, bossy, and much too stiff. But Merlin makes his peace, since he has to put up with him for almost every show from now on. You know the rest.

entry.title: Crimson in the Pines
entry.summary:
Author: nooooplsnoooo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,770Chapters: 4/5Kudos: 236

Summary: The Prince, despite his best efforts, could not stop his hand from shaking as he held his sword to Merlin’s- no, not Merlin’s- pulse. The boy tried to crawl backwards a bit, away from the sharp edge, but Arthur just moved forward with him. The sword trembled with adrenaline against the sorcerer’s pale skin. Arthur couldn’t help but notice the boy’s ruddy cheeks, bright red from the cold and exertion. The snow made light dance in his tear tracks. The neckerchief that Merlin commonly wore was discarded on the snow; It must have fallen during the fight. It left his smooth neck exposed to the cold, riddled with goosebumps, and unmarred save for the blood-soaked steel, pressing in on his pulse point. Arthur could not deny that the… thing wearing Merlin’s face was beautiful. Merlin is forced to reveal his powers during an attack. Chaos and angst ensue. I feel like most people give Arthur too much credit in magic reveals.

entry.title: Le Morte d'Arthur: Destiny Calls
entry.summary:
Author: elfinnemrys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 74,901Chapters: 32/32Kudos: 76

Summary: Merlin has been wandering for centuries. Waiting for the exact, unknown time that Arthur shall rise again.He becomes a lady of King Henry VIII.He meets Robin Hood and they share a fondness that once reminded him of a certain Prince.He bumps into Matthew Hopkins, the Witchfinder General, more times than he would like, dying a different death each time.But he always comes back.He falls in love and, in turn, becomes a father, a grandfather, and a lonely old man still waiting, waiting, waiting.But this is Matty's story - Merlin's granddaughter. And the ghost of Arthur follows her everywhere.This fic is completed, so don't worry about me not updating it. All in due time :)

entry.title: How to Tame a Pendragon
entry.summary:
Author: MerlinsBrokenHeart

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,254Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 9

Summary: When Arthur Pendragon is sent by his father to buy out the struggling Gaius Zoo and Wildlife Sanctuary, he expects a simple business deal. Instead, he’s drawn into a web of secrets, betrayal, and magic. Merlin Ambrose, the zoo’s fiercely loyal zoologist, refuses to let the sanctuary fall into Uther Pendragon’s hands, and Arthur soon learns the true cost of his family’s legacy. As Arthur uncovers the truth about his mother’s death, his sister Morgana’s captivity, and the dark experiments carried out by his father, he must choose between loyalty and justice. With the help of Merlin and Morgana, Arthur fights to save the zoo, protect those he loves, and bring Uther to justice. Along the way, Arthur and Merlin’s relationship evolves from adversaries to partners—and ultimately, to lovers—proving that found family and courage can overcome even the darkest of legacies. Expect magic, animal chaos, emotional healing, and a dramatic showdown that changes everything and brings Uther to his knees.

entry.title: The Price of Magic
entry.summary:
Author: Belle_Lestrange101

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 88,746Chapters: 20/35Kudos: 149

Summary: Unsatisfied with his current life, Merlin takes a sabbatical from work and explores the British coastline to clear his head of life's mundaneness. On his return from Cornwall, he comes across a young blonde girl attempting to hitch-hike along the motorway. Fearing for her safety, Merlin offers her a ride home.Upon entering the small town of Cam-Lott, Merlin makes a lasting impression on Police Chief Arthur Pendranyl and starts a chain of events that have him seeing the inside of a jail cell more often than not. When he isn't being an errand-boy or stumbling upon strange trinkets in forest caves, Merlin slots into the small town life with ease. Between summer faire's, camping trips and hiking, Merlin almost forgets that no one in the town -except one -has left the towns perimeter.Why has no one left? Why are his memories feeling hazier by the day? And why, oh why, is there a sword buried in a stone?[Rating will change in later chapters]
